text: ยง 9-120 Reports of subordinate officers. The chief officer of any institution under the charge of the commissioner of correction shall report once in each week to the commissioner of correction. Such report shall set forth: 1. The number of persons who have been received, discharged or transferred. 2. The number who have become sick or who have died. 3. The number remaining in the institution under the charge of such chief officer. 4. The discipline which has been maintained. 5. The quantity and kind of labor performed. 6. Such other information as the commissioner of correction requires.
